io.rouz.flo

Interface TaskContext

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AsyncContext, InMemImmediateContext, InstrumentedContext, MemoizingContext

    public interface TaskContext
    A context for controlling Task evaluation and TaskContext.Value computation.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  TaskContext.Promise<T>
      A promise for a TaskContext.Value that is supposed to be TaskContext.Promise.set(Object).
      static interface  TaskContext.Value<T>
      A wrapped value with additional semantics for how the enclosed value becomes available and how computations on that value are executed.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static org.slf4j.Logger LOG 

    • Method Summary

      • LOG

        static final org.slf4j.Logger LOG

    • Method Detail

      • evaluate

        default <T> TaskContext.Value<T> evaluate(Task<T> task)
        The entry point for evaluating a TaskContext.Value from a Task.

        All upstreams to the task will also be evaluated through this same method.

        The implementation should define how and where evaluation happens.

        This method is a good place to define how for instance value memoization happens.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the task result
        Parameters:
        task - The task to evaluate
        Returns:
        A value of the task result

      • evaluateInternal

        default <T> TaskContext.Value<T> evaluateInternal(Task<T> task,
                                                  TaskContext context)
        A variant of evaluate(Task) that allows the caller to specify the TaskContext that should be used within the graph during evaluation.

        This is intended to be called from TaskContext implementations that form a composition of other contexts.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the task result
        Parameters:
        task - The task to evaluate
        context - The context to use in further evaluation
        Returns:
        A value of the task result

      • invokeProcessFn

        default <T> TaskContext.Value<T> invokeProcessFn(TaskId taskId,
                                                 Fn<TaskContext.Value<T>> processFn)
        Invoke the process function of a task.

        This method will be called when the process function of a task is ready to be invoked. This gives this TaskContext the responsibility of invoking user code. By overriding this method, one can intercept the evaluation flow just at the moment between inputs being ready and when the user supplied function for task processing is being invoked.

        The default implementation will simply invoke the function immediately.

        Interception of curried process functions will gate the innermost function, while for regular arity 1-3 process functions gating happens around the whole function. todo: reconsider difference between arity and curried function interception.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The task value type
        Parameters:
        taskId - The id of the task being invoked
        processFn - A lazily evaluated handle to the process function
        Returns:
        The value of the process function invocation

      • currentTaskId

        default Optional<TaskId> currentTaskId()
        When called from within any of the functions passed to processWithContext, this method will return the TaskId of the task being processed. Otherwise an empty value will be returned.

        The return value of this method is stable for each instance of TaskContext that is passed into the process functions. Calls from multiple threads will see the same result as longs as the calls are made to the same instance.

        Returns:
        The id of the task that is being evaluated or empty if called from outside of a process function

      • value

        <T> TaskContext.Value<T> value(Fn<T> value)
        Create a TaskContext.Value with semantics defined by this TaskContext
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the value
        Parameters:
        value - A value value supplier
        Returns:
        A value with added semantics

      • immediateValue

        default <T> TaskContext.Value<T> immediateValue(T value)
        Create a TaskContext.Value with semantics defined by this TaskContext
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the value
        Parameters:
        value - An actual value to wrap
        Returns:
        A value with added semantics

      • promise

        <T> TaskContext.Promise<T> promise()
        Create a promise for a value that can be fulfilled somewhere else.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the promised value
        Returns:
        A promise

      • toValueList

        default <T> Collector<TaskContext.Value<T>,?,TaskContext.Value<List<T>>> toValueList()
        A Collector that collects a Stream of TaskContext.Values into a TaskContext.Value of a List.

        The semantics of joining TaskContext.Values is decided by this TaskContext.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The inner type of the values
        Returns:
        A collector for a stream of values

      • inmem

        static TaskContext inmem()
        Create a default, in-memory, immediate TaskContext. The values produced by this context should behave like synchronously created values. All graph memoization is done completely in memory.
        Returns:
        The context

      • async

        static TaskContext async(Executor executor)
        Create an asynchronous TaskContext that executes all evaluation on the given Executor.
        Parameters:
        executor - The executor to run evaluations on
        Returns:
        The asynchronous context
